metadata.title: CVE-2015-7700 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Double-free vulnerability in the sPLT chunk structure and png.c in pngcrushbefore 1.7.87 allows attackers to have unspecified impact via unknownvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pngcrush - 1.8.13-0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pngcrush package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.13-0.1').
